symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be diffuse and spreading
symptoms.pattern: Begins in one area (e.g., cheek) and spreads to trunk and extremities; can spare genitals, palms, and soles

symptoms.name: Vesicles
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be eroded and coalescing
symptoms.pattern: Diffuse, often on face, neck, and upper trunk; may rupture to form crusted ulcers

symptoms.name: Fever
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be low-grade or high (up to 104.3°F)

symptoms.name: Itching
symptoms.severity: Intensely pruritic in some cases (Eczema Herpeticum)

symptoms.name: Lymphadenopathy
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present

vital_signs.temperature: Elevated, ranging from low-grade fever to 104.3°F (40.3°C)

physical_findings: Lesions may be localized to areas of atopic dermatitis
risk_factors: Contact with individuals with active herpes infection

required: Clinical presentation consistent with herpesviral vesicular dermatitis (vesicles, fever, rash)
